entry.title: Amazon Won't Remove Books Listed Under a Real Author's Name But Allegedly Written With AI
entry.summary: Journalist Jane Friedman says her name is being used to sell books written with AI on Amazon, prompting concerns over author verification.

entry.title: OpenAI to Unleash New Web Crawler to Devour More of the Open Web
entry.summary: You'll have to opt-out if you don't want your online content used for AI training.

entry.title: Central Bank of Brazil Reveals Name of Its Controversial CBDC
entry.summary: Although only a few financial institutions can handle DREX, its implementation is expected to help Brazilians access more banking products.

entry.title: Elon Musk-Backed Brain Hacking Firm Neuralink Raises $280 Million
entry.summary: The biotechnology firm obtained significant financial support for its brain-computer interface development from Peter Thiel’s Founders Fund.

entry.title: PayPal PYUSD Stablecoin Could Breed Competition and Force Regulators to Act
entry.summary: From BlackRock-level excitement to a total “nothingburger,” reactions to PayPal's stablecoin are mixed—but it's got the whole industry talking.

entry.title: Neopets Fans ‘Care Less’ About Crypto, CEO Says
entry.summary: World of Neopia CEO Dominic Law told Decrypt that the game studio has “scarce resources” despite raising $4 million earlier this year.

entry.title: PayPal Stablecoin Fakes Flood Ethereum—Here's How to Find the Real One
entry.summary: The announcement of PayPal's PYUSD has sparked a wave of imposter tokens on Uniswap, exploiting the hype.

entry.title: AI Can Tell What You Type By Listening to Your Keystrokes
entry.summary: Forget surreptitiously installed keyloggers—your keyboard can give away what you’re writing through the sounds it makes.

entry.title: Reddit Moons and Bricks Soar After Kraken Listing
entry.summary: Reddit users are rewarded with the tokens based on engagement.

entry.title: Many Early Blockchain Games Were 'Cash Grabs,' Says Twitch Streamer Alliestrasza
entry.summary: "I wrote them off," Twitch streamer Alliestrasza said of her initial thoughts on many early blockchain games. She tells Decrypt's Jason Nelson about how her perspective on Web3 games has evolved over time and now sees blockchain games getting significantly better.

entry.title: Investors Have Stopped Shorting Bitcoin for First Time in 3 Months, Says CoinShares
entry.summary: Crypto funds are still taking profits, with the latest CoinShares report revealing the biggest weekly sell-off since March this year.

entry.title: Payments Giant PayPal to Launch Dollar-Pegged Stablecoin on Ethereum
entry.summary: PayPal announced today the launch of a native dollar-pegged stablecoin backed by cash equivalents and short-term treasuries.

entry.title: Long-Term Bitcoin Holder Metric Hits New All-Time High
entry.summary: On-chain data shows Bitcoin long-term holders now hold 14.599 million BTC, the highest value the metric has ever seen.

entry.title: Stablecoin Deposits on Maker Soar as DAI Interest Rates Hit 8%
entry.summary: The amount of DAI minted and deposited back into the Maker protocol has surged dramatically since the latest upgrade.

entry.title: $1.8M Bounty Now Open to Public as Curve Finance Hacker Misses Deadline
entry.summary: The Curve bounty sits at 10% of the stolen funds, roughly $1.85 million, and was announced via an on-chain Ethereum message.

entry.title: Zuck v. Musk and Other Famous Feuds in Web3 History
entry.summary: In such a turbulent world dominated by strong personalities and potentially large sums of speculative cash flying around, it’s perhaps to be expected that high-profile feuds and fights will develop.

entry.title: Huobi Crypto Exchange Grapples with Rumors of Insolvency Amidst Hefty Outflows
entry.summary: Crypto analyst Adam Cochran dismissed claims by the company's community manager that his information "has been pure rumors."

author.name: Decrypt AI, Edited by Ryan Ozawa

entry.title: Superconductor Hype Sparks Flurry of LK-99 Memecoins
entry.summary: The nascent cluster of coins seeks to surge on the latest technological buzz.

entry.title: NFT Trader Admits Nabbing $1.5 Million in Ethereum After ‘Elizab.eth’ Gets Rekt on Blur
entry.summary: Spotting a bot mimicking his trades, Hanwe Chang used the strategy against its owner to earn a huge premium.

entry.title: You Can Try On Copenhagen Fashion Week's Latest Styles in the Metaverse
entry.summary: Luxury mobile style game Drest is teaming up with the leading fashion event in Scandinavia, enhancing its product with Web3 elements.

entry.title: Dungeons & Dragons Publisher to Tighten Artist Guidelines After AI Art Found in Book
entry.summary: California artist and musician Ilya Shkipin defended his use of artificial intelligence on Twitter, sharing examples before deleting them.

entry.title: This Week on Crypto Twitter: SBF Accused of Executing Massive Rug Pull from House Arrest
entry.summary: It probably wasn’t him, however, given the austere technological limitations under which he's living.

entry.title: What Meta, Amazon, Google, Apple and AMD Are Saying About AI
entry.summary: The AI hype is real, and based on their latest earnings reports, all of the multibillion-dollar behemoths of tech sector are going all in.

entry.title: Elon Musk: 'We Never Will' Launch a Twitter or X Crypto Token
entry.summary: The blunt declaration came after the Tesla CEO replied to a warning about scam tokens claiming to be affiliated with his company.

entry.title: From Friday Night Bet to Astrology Star: The Story of Kundli GPT
entry.summary: Kundli GPT, a chatbot based on OpenAI's technology, provides individualized astrological data to users, amassing 20 million visitors thanks to social media.

entry.title: KPMG Bitcoin Report Marks 'A Milestone The Bitcoin Ecosystem Should Celebrate': Analyst
entry.summary: “Demonstrating how Bitcoin makes positive contributions is critical to both mainstream and institutional comfort,” says Daniel Batten, ESG analyst and CH4 Capital co-founder.

entry.title: How Does AI Affect Kids? Psychologists Weigh In
entry.summary: Experts warn children may form emotional bonds with AI, overshadowing human relationships and hindering social skills development.

entry.title: This Week in Coins: Sparse News Extends Streak of Underwhelming Bitcoin and Ethereum Prices
entry.summary: Although Coinbase CEO Brian Armstrong did reveal that the SEC asked his exchange to delist all cryptocurrencies except Bitcoin.

entry.title: Curve Finance Chaos Is a $110 Million Gut Check for DeFi
entry.summary: If DeFi still needs "handshake" deals and fleet of crypto influencers to keep it afloat, is it really better than traditional finance?

entry.title: Twitter User Has @Music Handle 'Ripped Away' by Elon Musk
entry.summary: First "@X" and now "@Music." Popular Twitter handles are being seized by the newly rebranded X.

entry.title: FDIC Sends Cease-and-Desist to Crypto Firm That Shuttered in June
entry.summary: The FDIC alleges the firm made false claims about FDIC insurance coverage two months after the company announced ceasing operations.

entry.title: AI Researchers Claim They Can Double the Efficiency of Chatbots
entry.summary: Abacus AI claims to have found a way to fine-tune LLMs, making them capable of processing 200% their original context token capacity.

entry.title: Mech Shooter 'MetalCore' Is 'Titanfall' Meets 'Destiny' With an NFT Twist
entry.summary: PREVIEW: Ever wanted to own a mech? Immutable zkEVM game MetalCore will let you do just that, and the early playtest shows serious promise.

entry.title: 'MetalCore' Game Preview: Hands-on With the 'Titanfall' Meets 'Destiny' NFT Mash-Up
entry.summary: MetalCore is an upcoming mech shooter developed by Studio 369, and it's being developed on Ethereum scaling network Immutable zkEVM. Decrypt contributor Ryan Gladwin played through the prologue and tested out the recent Alpha 3 online experience to get a sense of the NFT-infused mash-up of Titanfall and Destiny.

entry.title: Can Live Music NFTs Revive 'Cassette Culture' and Boost Indie Bands?
entry.summary: Solana music platform Vault’s latest initiative could elevate and support underground artists via exclusive NFT drops from live performances.

entry.title: Coinbase Wants SEC Lawsuit Thrown Out, Says Gensler Overstepped His Authority
entry.summary: America’s largest crypto exchange said Friday that the SEC had no authority to pursue its lawsuit.

entry.title: Zero10 and JD Sports Offer Virtual Try-On of Nike Apparel at IRL Stores
entry.summary: ZERO10’s AR Mirrors animate the new JD Sports x Nike Need it Now collection, allowing visitors to virtually try on 18 items—some of which come with additional AR enhancement effects like water droplets.

entry.title: Decrypt’s Guide to Stable Diffusion: The Most Powerful Open-Source Tool for AI Image Generation
entry.summary: Be it a "hyperrealistic portrait of Emma Watson as a sorceress" or an "intricate digital painting of a pirate in a fantasy setting," the only limit is your imagination.

entry.title: Twitter Bot Activity Increased After FTX Listed Tokens, Report Finds
entry.summary: A report by the Network Contagion Research Institute found that "inauthentic chatter" increased to 50% after being listed by FTX.

entry.title: 'Give Projects a Chance,' Says Aurory's Michael Natoli on NFT Game Challenges
entry.summary: Aurory is an NFT-driven game franchise that started life on Solana and is expanding to other chains. Decrypt's Jason Nelson spoke with Aurory Head of Marketing Michael Natoli at Solana's PlayGG event, where Natoli shared his thoughts on the challenges that blockchain games face in reaching players.

entry.title: Solana Is Only Network Ready for Gaming: Solana Foundation's Johnny Lee
entry.summary: Solana Foundation General Manager Johnny Lee tells Decrypt's Jason Nelson about how the Solana network will tackle the scaling problem that blockchain games pose for the industry.

entry.title: Com2uS Is Going "Full Speed" on Crypto Gaming: Kyu Lee
entry.summary: Kyu Lee is the President of game studio Com2uS USA. In an interview, he shares the studio's approach to Web3 and crypto gaming with Decrypt GG's Kate Irwin.

entry.title: Building a Discord Game with AI and Blockchain: 'Alchemy: Battle for Ankhos' Creative Lead Alex Finden
entry.summary: Decrypt's Jason Nelson interviews Alchemy: Battle for Ankhos Creative Director Alex Finden at the Solana PlayGG event in San Diego, California.

entry.title: 'Big Respect Between Ethereum and Cosmos Developer Communities': dYdX Foundation CEO
entry.summary: CEO of the dYdX Foundation Charles d'Haussy unpacks the decision behind moving one of the largest decentralized exchange protocol's over to its very own chain built on Cosmos. A key driver, he told Decrypt at this year's EthCC event, was that instead of launching on a rollup or another layer-1, launching a fully customized chain will allow dYdX to fine tune the network for its product's needs.

entry.title: Ethereum Staking Solution Lido 'Had Perfect Product Market Fit' at Launch, Says DAO's Biz Dev Contributor
entry.summary: Marin Tvrdić, a business development contributor to the Lido DAO, sat down with Decrypt during this year's EthCC to break down how the liquid staking protocol has managed such a massive lead, how it plans to keep that lead, and the protocol's new dual-governance tokenomics.

entry.title: What's Going to Stop All the DeFi Hacks? 'Standards,' Says OpenZepplin Security Architect
entry.summary: OpenZeppelin's security solutions architect Michael Lewellen sat down with Decrypt to discuss how the industry can become a little safer for users at this year's EthCC Paris. The key? Introducing security standards across the industry so folks know what an audit actually means and where risks lie, be it bad faith actors or poor implementation.

entry.title: 'Ev.io' Game Review: Earn Solana While Blasting Enemies
entry.summary: Ev.io is a web-based first-person shooter that's free to play, but lets NFT holders earn in-game currency that can be redeemed for Solana (SOL). Decrypt contributor Ryan Gladwin shares his review of the fun throwback to Quake-style blasting, albeit with a modern crypto twist.

entry.title: 'Moving Fast and Breaking Things Isn't the Web3 Ethos': MetaMask Product Lead
entry.summary: Account abstraction this, smart wallets that. Discussions at EthCC Paris about improving user experience have pointed at industry leader MetaMask as an example of what not to do. But that may soon change, with a host of updates and optimizations coming to crypto's number one wallet, said its product lead Alex Jupiter. It still may take some time, though, before these changes take effect.

entry.title: Scaling Smart Wallets on Starknet 'Was The Winning Combination', Says Argent Co-Founder
entry.summary: Argent co-founder Julien Niset told Decrypt at EthCC Paris that he wants to make crypto wallets disappear. Or at least how they're currently conceived. From clunky seed phrases to a stiff user experience, Argent hopes to make using crypto a little less intimidating and a whole lot more fun.

entry.title: Inside Mighty Action Heroes' Open Beta
entry.summary: Mighty Action Heroes is the flagship blockchain title from Mighty Bear Games. But is the browser-based battle royale shooter worth checking out? Decrypt's Kate Irwin offers her thoughts and a first look at the upcoming game.

entry.title: Dr. Disrespect's 'Deadrop': Early Access Gameplay From Snapshot VI
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin playtests Dr. Disrespect and Midnight Society's first-person shooter Deadrop and shares the latest game updates, as well as her opinions on the game in development. Currently, Deadrop offers Polygon Founders Pass NFTs with no other crypto plans revealed just yet.

entry.title: 'More and More' Game Publishers Will Embrace NFTs: Mythical Games CEO
entry.summary: In the wake of EA Sports and Fortnite creator Epic Games embracing Nike's NFT platform, Mythical Games CEO John Linden tells Decrypt's Andrew Hayward how quickly he expects to see more major traditional game publishers enter the blockchain space and how quickly the industry will scale.

entry.title: Gran Saga Unlimited Early Access: Inside the Anime MMORPG on Aptos
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin plays Gran Saga: Unlimited's second community playtest, reports her findings, and offers her opinion and insights on the upcoming game, which will offer optional Aptos NFTs.

entry.title: 100 Thieves' Moe Says Blockchain Games Will 'Eventually' Be Accepted by Livestreamers
entry.summary: 100 Thieves content creator and gamer Moe also goes by "Yassuo" online after his favorite League of Legends character. Decrypt's Kate Irwin asks him about 100 Thieves' future crypto plans and whether Moe thinks creators like xQc and Pokimane might ever come around to blockchain games.
